class.name: VoxelBoxMover
class.description: Utility class allowing to reproduce simple move-and-slide logic using only voxel AABBs, similar to Minecraft physics. This class may only be used with blocky voxels. Store an instance of it within a member variable of your script, and use it within [method Node._process] or [method Node._physics_process] (it works wherever you like). [codeblock] var motion = Vector3(0, 0, -10 * delta) # Move forward motion = _box_mover.get_motion(get_translation(), motion, aabb, terrain_node) global_translate(motion) [/codeblock]

method.name: get_collision_mask
method.description: Gets the collision mask used to detect collidable voxels. This collision mask is specific to this collision system, and is defined in [member VoxelBlockyModel.collision_mask].

method.name: get_motion
method.description: Given a motion vector, returns a modified vector telling you by how much to move your character. This is similar to [method KinematicBody.move_and_slide], except you have to apply the movement.

method.name: has_stepped_up
method.description: When step climbing is enabled, tells when the last call to [method get_motion] caused climbing to occur. Climbing modifies the motion vector upwards so that the body is snapped on top of the step. This can have implications in character controller code, such as considering the character to be on the floor instead of having jumped.

method.name: is_step_climbing_enabled
method.description: Tells if step climbing is enabled.

method.name: set_collision_mask
method.description: Sets the collision mask used to detect collidable voxels. Only voxels sharing at least one bit between the masks will be detected. This collision mask is specific to this collision system, and is defined in [member VoxelBlockyModel.collision_mask].

method.name: set_max_step_height
method.description: Sets the maximum height that can be climbed like "stairs".

method.name: set_step_climbing_enabled
method.description: When enabled, [method get_motion] will attempt to climb up small steps. This allows to implement Minecraft-like stairs.
